verbs.description: disgorge (third-person singular simple present disgorges, present participle disgorging, simple past and past participle disgorged)

entries.meaning: To vomit or spew, to discharge.
examples: This mountain when it rageth  […]  casteth forth huge stones, disgorgeth brimstone.

entries.meaning: (law) To surrender (stolen goods or money, for example) unwillingly.
(oenology) To remove traces of yeast from sparkling wine by the méthode champenoise.
